security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill with no executable code. It defines workflow instructions for running ESLint and TypeScript checks. Uses standard dev commands only. Includes appropriate guardrails for safe operation.

content.user_title: Lint and type check frontend code
content.value_statement: Code quality issues can slip through reviews and cause production bugs. This skill runs ESLint and TypeScript checks to catch syntax errors, style violations, and type mismatches before code is committed.
actual_capabilities: Run ESLint checks on the frontend directory
Execute TypeScript compilation without emitting files
Report lint errors, warnings, and type errors with file locations
Apply automatic fixes to ESLint issues with user confirmation
limitations: Requires npm and TypeScript to be installed in the project
Cannot fix TypeScript type errors automatically
Only supports frontend directory structure with npm scripts

use_cases.title: Pre-commit validation
use_cases.description: Validate code before committing to catch issues early in the development workflow

use_cases.title: Review preparation
use_cases.description: Check submitted code for style and type issues before detailed review

use_cases.title: Automated quality gates
use_cases.description: Run automated linting as part of continuous integration checks

prompt_templates.title: Type error check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check for type errors in the frontend code

output: Type check passed with no errors
Run 'npm run lint -- --fix' to apply automatic fixes

best_practices: Run lint and type checks before every commit to catch issues early
Review all errors and warnings before applying automatic fixes
Do not modify tsconfig.json to suppress legitimate type errors
anti_patterns: Running lint only after completing a large feature
Applying --fix without reviewing what will be changed
Ignoring type errors and hoping they will resolve themselves

faq.question: Does this skill modify my source files?
faq.answer: Only with explicit user confirmation when using --fix for ESLint. TypeScript checks never modify files.

faq.question: What directories does this skill access?
faq.answer: It accesses only the frontend directory and its subdirectories where npm scripts run.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with non-React projects?
faq.answer: Yes, as long as the project uses ESLint and TypeScript with standard npm scripts.

faq.question: How long do lint and type checks take?
faq.answer: Execution time depends on codebase size. Most medium projects complete in under 30 seconds.

faq.question: What happens if npm is not installed?
faq.answer: The skill will fail with a command not found error. Ensure npm and dependencies are installed first.

faq.question: How is this different from running lint manually?
faq.answer: This skill provides a standardized workflow with clear reporting and safety guardrails for automation.
